summary: Completed comprehensive testing of SpendAlizer Personal Finance Management App. Backend APIs are fully functional with 11/11 tests passing. Frontend has core functionality working but has some UI component issues with Select dropdowns and React runtime errors that prevent complete end-to-end testing.

minor_issues.issue: Python linting errors: unused import, bare except clauses
minor_issues.impact: Code quality issues, no functional impact

critical_bugs.issue: React runtime error: Select.Item must have a value prop that is not an empty string
critical_bugs.impact: Prevents CSV import and rule creation functionality

ui_bugs.issue: Dropdown options not clickable in modal dialogs
ui_bugs.impact: User cannot complete import or rule creation workflows

code_quality_issues.issue: Empty value props on SelectItem components

critical_fixes: Fix Select component value prop errors in TransactionsPage.js (lines 107, 120) - replace empty string values with meaningful values or remove
Fix Select dropdown interaction issues in Import and Rules pages - ensure proper event handling for option selection
Resolve React runtime errors preventing complete UI functionality
recommended_fixes: Refactor useEffect in App.js to avoid synchronous setState
Fix component definition issues in calendar.jsx
Clean up Python linting errors in backend/server.py

success_percentage.frontend: 70% - Core features work, dropdown interactions need fixes
